meanings.definition: Lacking interest or excitement; dull and uninteresting.
meanings.sent1: The lecture was so dryasdusts that most students fell asleep.
meanings.sent2: The book was so dryasdusts that I couldn't finish reading it.
meanings.sent3: The party was dryasdusts, but we tried to liven it up with some music.
meanings.sent4: Her presentation was as dryasdusts as a desert without a drop of water.
meanings.sent5: The movie was incredibly dryasdusts, making even the popcorn seem more exciting.

meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of dry, powdery dust.
meanings.sent1: The old attic was filled with dryasdusts boxes and forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent2: After the earthquake, everything in the room was covered in dryasdusts debris.
meanings.sent3: The car looked like it had been through a dryasdusts storm of dirt and sand.
meanings.sent4: The ancient scrolls were hidden in a chamber full of dryasdusts relics.
meanings.sent5: The path was lined with dryasdusts rocks, creating a dusty trail to follow.
